ticket.tag: array hash json orderedhash to_json to_xml xml
ticket.title: Export OrderedHash to XML and JSON
ticket.original-body: When exporting OrderedHash objects with to_json or to_xml, they become arrays and doesn't stay as hashes. With those methods, they're exported as if they were hashes.
ticket.latest-body: When exporting OrderedHash objects with to_json or to_xml, they become arrays and doesn't stay as hashes. With those methods, they're exported as if they were hashes.
ticket.original-body-html: When exporting OrderedHash objects with to_json or to_xml, they become arrays and doesn't stay as hashes. With those methods, they're exported as if they were hashes.

version.body:
How about doing something like the following?
@@@ ruby def to_json to_hash.to_json end
def to_xml to_hash.to_xml end @@@
This way we won't need to maintain the code for cerating JSON and XML in multiple places.
version.body-html:
How about doing something like the following?


def to_json
  to_hash.to_json
end

def to_xml
  to_hash.to_xml
end

This way we won't need to maintain the code for cerating JSON and XML in multiple places.
version.tag: array hash json orderedhash to_json to_xml xml
version.title: Export OrderedHash to XML and JSON

version.body:
Oh btw, that attitude is not very nice. I would have not replied if I had seen your last comment.
People are busy with work _and_ busy creating/fixing code that _you_ can use, for free. It's also stated very clear in the explanation in the right hand bar. But I guess you didn't read that.
“Then don't get your hopes up. Unless you have a "Code Red, Mission Critical, The World is Coming to an End" kinda bug, you're creating this ticket in the hope that others with the same problem will be able to collaborate with you on solving it. Do not expect that the ticket automatically will see any activity or that others will jump to fix it. Creating a ticket like this is mostly to help yourself start on the path of fixing the problem and for others to sign on to with a "I'm having this problem too"..”
version.body-html:

“Then don't get your hopes up. Unless you have a "Code Red, Mission Critical, The World is Coming to an End" kinda bug, you're creating this ticket in the hope that others with the same problem will be able to collaborate with you on solving it. Do not expect that the ticket automatically will see any activity or that others will jump to fix it. Creating a ticket like this is mostly to help yourself start on the path of fixing the problem and for others to sign on to with a "I'm having this problem too"..”

version.body: Well in my case it was. I have a date for every key of the hash (in the format "YYYY-MM-DD) and I need it to be ordered by date, even when I give it in json or xml (otherwise the application using the feed need to reorder it).
version.body-html: Well in my case it was. I have a date for every key of the hash (in the format "YYYY-MM-DD) and I need it to be ordered by date, even when I give it in json or xml (otherwise the application using the feed need to reorder it).
version.tag: array hash json orderedhash to_json to_xml xml
version.title: Export OrderedHash to XML and JSON

version.body:
At least in JSON the spec (json.org) says clearly:
“An object is an __unordered__ set of name/value pairs. An object begins with { (left brace) and ends with } (right brace). Each name is followed by : (colon) and the name/value pairs are separated by , (comma).”
From googling it seems that in XML the same applies, but I haven't found a definitive answer yet so you'd have to look this up more thoroughly.
version.body-html:
At least in JSON the spec (json.org) says clearly:

“An object is an unordered set of name/value pairs. An object begins with { (left brace) and ends with } (right brace). Each name is followed by : (colon) and the name/value pairs are separated by , (comma).”

From googling it seems that in XML the same applies, but I haven't found a definitive answer yet so you'd have to look this up more thoroughly.
version.tag: array hash json orderedhash to_json to_xml xml
version.title: Export OrderedHash to XML and JSON

version.body: Maybe someone on rubyonrails-core@googlegroups.com knows this about XML?

version.tag: array hash json orderedhash to_json to_xml xml
version.title: Export OrderedHash to XML and JSON

version.body:
In XML, order may or may not matter. It's application-dependent.
My opinion: writing your app to rely on Rails to spit out XML/JSON automatically in some order (ASCII order?) is a bad idea. It's not actually part of either the JSON or XML specs to do so. It's a fragile approach.
I'm not against this patch, but kazhar, I would strongly suggest a different approach for your app. It is quite likely, since this is NOT a formally-defined behavior for JSON/XML, that sometime in the future a subsequent patch will get applied which will revert this behavior.
Just write a .rxml and spit it out ordered by date. Or create an ActiveRecord::Base subclass with "abstract_class = true" that overrides the to_xml/to_json methods. Use the Ruby sort method and spit out what you need.
version.body-html:
In XML, order may or may not matter. It's application-dependent.

My opinion: writing your app to rely on Rails to spit out XML/JSON automatically in some order (ASCII order?) is a bad idea. It's not actually part of either the JSON or XML specs to do so. It's a fragile approach.

I'm not against this patch, but kazhar, I would strongly suggest a different approach for your app. It is quite likely, since this is NOT a formally-defined behavior for JSON/XML, that sometime in the future a subsequent patch will get applied which will revert this behavior.

Just write a .rxml and spit it out ordered by date. Or create an ActiveRecord::Base subclass with "abstract_class = true" that overrides the to_xml/to_json methods. Use the Ruby sort method and spit out what you need.
version.tag: array hash json orderedhash to_json to_xml xml
version.title: Export OrderedHash to XML and JSON

version.body: Also, I just remembered OrderedHash is a subclass of Hash nowadays, so this probably already works as it should in 2.3. (That is, dumping as an unordered hash).
version.body-html: Also, I just remembered OrderedHash is a subclass of Hash nowadays, so this probably already works as it should in 2.3. (That is, dumping as an unordered hash).
version.tag: array hash json orderedhash to_json to_xml xml
version.title: Export OrderedHash to XML and JSON
